docstr:
`ERF` — Error function

### Description
`ERF(X)` computes the error function of `X`.



### Syntax
`RESULT = ERF(X)`


### Arguments

     
.






### Return value
The return value is of type `REAL`, of the same kind as
`X` and lies in the range -1 \leq erf (x) \leq 1 .



### Example

     ```


program test_erf

  real(8) :: x = 0.17_8

  x = erf(x)

end program test_erf

```



### Specific names

     
 | Name             | Argument           | Return type        | Standard

 | `DERF(X)`   | `REAL(8) X`   | `REAL(8)`     | GNU extension





### Standard
Fortran 2008 and later



### Class
Elemental function
